question: The output will be a LOW for any case when one or more inputs are zero in a(n):
If a signal passing through a gate is inhibited by sending a low into one of the inputs, and the output is HIGH, the gate is a(n):
A single transistor can be used to build which of the following digital logic gates?
The logic gate that will have HIGH or "1" at its output when any one of its inputs is HIGH is a(n):
How many NAND circuits are contained in a 7400 NAND IC?
Exclusive-OR (XOR) logic gates can be constructed from what other logic gates?
c: AND gates, OR gates, and NOT gates
answer: AND gates, OR gates, and NOT gates

question: How many truth table entries are necessary for a four-input circuit?
A NAND gate has:
a: LOW inputs and a LOW output
b: HIGH inputs and a HIGH output
c: LOW inputs and a HIGH output
answer: LOW inputs and a HIGH output

question: The basic logic gate whose output is the complement of the input is the:
What input values will cause an AND logic gate to produce a HIGH output?
a: At least one input is HIGH.
b: At least one input is LOW.

question: The output of an exclusive-OR (XOR) gate is 1 only when the inputs are different.
If the output of a gate is OFF when the inputs are the same, and ON when they are different, the gate must be an exclusive-OR.
The output of a NAND gate is the same as the inverted output of an AND gate.
Logic gate circuits contain predictable gate functions that open their outputs.
If both inputs are required to be ON for the output to be ON, the gate must be an AND gate.
A NAND gate consists of an AND gate and an OR gate connected in series with each other.
The exclusive-NOR (XNOR) gate is simply an OR gate followed by a NOT gate.
A logic circuit whose output is LOW when at least one input is HIGH is a(n) _________ gate.
The AND function can be used to ___________ and the OR function can be used to _____________.
The dependency notation ">= 1" inside a block stands for the ________ operation.
If we use an AND gate to inhibit a signal from passing, one of the inputs must be _________.
